articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Algerian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Algerian President

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Abdelaziz Bouteflika, President of Algeria, on Oct. 30 on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of the start of the revolution in Algeria.
						 Kim in the message wished the president and the government of Algeria greater successes in the efforts for the stability, unity and prosperity of the country and expressed belief that the bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation would continue to consolidate and develop in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to PM of Antigua Barbuda
articles.content:
Greetings to PM of Antigua Barbuda

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Baldwin Spencer, Prime Minister of Antigua Barbuda, on October 27 on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of its independence.
						 In the message, Kim Yong Il wished the prime minister success in his work for prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Red Cross Meeting Held
articles.content:
DPRK Red Cross Meeting Held

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- A DPRK Red Cross meeting was held at the Chollima House of Culture on Oct. 29 and 30.
						 It was attended by members of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society and Red Cross officials in Pyongyang and local areas. 
						
						 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the delegation of the International Committee of the Red Cross working in the DPRK.
						
						 At the meeting Jang Jae On, chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society, made a report reviewing the work of its central committee. 
						
						 The reporter referred to the successes made in the period under review and underscored the need for the Red Cross Society to intensify the activities for health and hygiene with main emphasis on fulfilling the humanitarian mission to contribute to the improvement of the living of the victims of various disasters, protect and promote the health of people.
						
						The Red Cross Society will make positive efforts to solve the humanitarian issues by the efforts of the Koreans on the basis of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and develop the cooperation with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, the International Committee of the Red Cross and the Red Cross and Red Crescent organizations of different countries. 
						
						 Then, speeches were made.
						
						The statute of the DPRK Red Cross Society was revised and a development strategy and orientations of the work in different fields till 2012 were discussed at the meeting. 
						
						 The Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society arranged a reception on Oct. 30 in connection with the founding anniversary of the Red Cross Society and the Red Cross meeting.

articles.title: 11th People's Sports Contest Closes
articles.content:
11th People's Sports Contest Closes

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The 11th People's Sports Contest of the DPRK closed with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Oct. 31.
						 The national records were renewed in the 18 various events of shooting, archery, field and track, swimming and weightlifting in the contest. 
						
						 In the field of sports groups, players of the April 25 Sports Group emerged winners in women's football, men's and women's basketball and men's and women's volleyball, and players of the Sobaeksu Sports Group in men's football.
						
						 In the field of mass sports, players of  Pyongyang city came first in men's basketball and men's and women's volleyball, and players of the Ministry of Railways in football and women's basketball.
						
						 Present at the closing ceremony were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, officials of the working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, sportspersons and working people.

articles.title: 39th Sports Contest of Artistes Held
articles.content:
39th Sports Contest of Artistes Held

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The 39th sports contest of artistes took place at the Kim Il Sung Stadium on Oct. 31.
						 The contest which was divided into groups of movie persons, stage artistes, educators and producers included football, basketball, volleyball, field and track and tug of war and other events.
						
						 In every event the players displayed high sports technique, collective spirit and noble moral traits. 
						
						 The group of educators placed first in group standing.

articles.title: New Film Produced
articles.content:
New Film Produced

					
						Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The April 25 Film Studio of the Korean People's Army produced feature film "Call of Naval Port".
						 The film impressively represents the noble spiritual world of a non-commissioned officer in extra service of a naval unit who has contributed to the strengthening of the unit's combat capability, devoting his life to defending the sea of the country with the honor of having had the peerlessly great persons at his post.
						
						 Through the hero's representation the film shows the true character of a human being in the Songun era who has carried out his revolutionary duty with clear conscience at a naval port of the country, firmly determined to bring pleasure to the Party and the leader at all times.

articles.title: Pine Nuts Picked from Pine Trees
articles.content:
Pine Nuts Picked from Pine Trees

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Forest Management Office of Riwon County, South Hamgyong Province, on the eastern coast of Korea has transformed pine tree forests into pine-nut tree forests, from which it is gathering a large amount of pine nuts.
						 Pine trees in the county with lean land all crooked to look ugly and be of little use.
						
						 The officials and employees of the office have created dozens of hectares of forest of pine-nut trees grafted to pine trees over a period of  scores of years out of patriotic desire to turn the mountains of the country into "golden mountains" and "treasure mountains" covered with thick verdure to be handed down to the coming generations.
						
						 In this course, the fruit bearing time has been moved up 8 to10 years and much workforce and materials consumed in nursing saplings have been saved.
						
						 The trees in more than 70 percent of the area turned into pine nut woods bear pine cones.
						
						 The scenic wonders unfolded there provide valuable experience in woodland transformation.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Implement North-South Joint Declaration
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Implement North-South Joint Declaration

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- We will never overlook the Lee Myung Pak group's traitorous acts of escalating the inter-Korean confrontation, refusing to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration but more strongly counter them. 
						 Rodong Sinmun Friday warns this in a signed article. 
						
						 It goes on:
						
						 The DPRK has recently taken a serious note of the fact that the present south Korean authorities are bringing back the favorably developing inter-Korean relations to those of acute confrontation in the period before the publication of the June 15 joint declaration in collusion with outside forces and re-clarified its principled stand toward the inter-Korean relations.
						
						 But the group utterly indifferent to the country and the nation and reunification has become so arrogant as to respond to the DPRK's demand by intensifying its moves for confrontation with it. It is persistently letting loose a spate of sophism intended to slander the just and fair stand of the DPRK and embellish its traitorous "policy toward the north", uttering such words as "threat" and "regret".
						
						 It is the unanimous desire of the fellow countrymen and the requirement of the history of the nation to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, a programme for honoring it. 
						
						 The group is now driving the inter-Korean relations to a serious situation reminiscent of the eve of their collapse, while insulting and defaming the DPRK's system and, furthermore, disclosing even its intention to invade the north. 
						
						 At the recent 40th south Korea-U.S. "annual security consultative meeting" the puppet warmongers again hatched a dangerous nuclear war plot to consolidate "military cooperation system" for stifling the DPRK and round up the overall operation posture for attacking it while calling for "preparations to cope with an emergency situation" of somebody. It is, at the same time, reneging on all military agreements between the north and the south by going on with the provocative scattering of leaflets. 
						
						 This glaringly reveals its belligerent ambition to stifle the DPRK at any cost in league with foreign forces, denying its ideology and system. 
						
						 We can never allow the Lee group to hurl slanders and calumnies at our just response while spelling out "threat" and "regret". It is more intolerable as it is a revelation of the group's sinister anti-reunification aim to vitiate the atmosphere of implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, denying the DPRK's ideology and system. 
						
						 To implement the above-said declarations is the only way of developing the inter-Korean relations and achieving the peace of the country and the common prosperity of the nation, concludes the article.

articles.title: Closer South-South Cooperation Called for
articles.content:
Closer South-South Cooperation Called for

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The present reality requires developing countries to boost South-South cooperation in the agricultural field, says Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article.
						 It goes on:
						
						 It is by no means difficult for developing countries to strengthen South-South cooperation in the agricultural field.
						
						 Developing countries have the bulk of agricultural resources and manpower resources in the world and possess experience and technique to a considerable extent enough to conduct exchange in the agricultural field. If they exchange, disseminate and develop even a single example of experience and technology, it is possible to solve a lot of problems arising in the agricultural field.
						
						 If they sincerely help and cooperate with each other on the principle of equality, mutual benefit and mutual accommodation, they can certainly develop agriculture and achieve self-sufficiency in food. 
						
						 Now that the Western countries are foolish enough to contend that it is impossible to settle the food problem without their assistance, developing countries should demonstrate their will to solve the food problem by their own efforts without difficulty through closer South-South cooperation.
						
						  Developing countries should effect South-South cooperation in the agricultural field, to begin with, in order to attain self-sufficiency in food, the most urgent problem at present.
						
						 They have the possibility to conduct favorable cooperation because of their common historical conditions and aspirations. If they develop the bilateral and regional cooperation and exchange, they can strengthen their independence in agriculture and achieve great success in solving the food problem, without relying on the developed countries. 
						
						 Developing countries should not forget the lesson drawn from the fact that they have failed to gain noticeable success in tackling the food crisis owing to the unreasonable moves of the imperialists but make every possible effort to strengthen South-South cooperation in the agricultural field.  
						
						 Herein lies the right way for developing countries to solve the food problem as early as possible and achieve independent progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Ceaseless Aerial Espionage Committed against DPRK
articles.content:
Ceaseless Aerial Espionage Committed against DPRK

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the south Korean puppet armed forces more frantically staged the war exercises against the DPRK and committed at least 150 cases of aerial espionage against it in October, according to a military source.
						On Oct. 24, the 71st Division of the south Korean puppet army launched "counter-intrusion exercises" by mobilizing huge forces and war equipment.
						
						 The south Korean puppets mobilized hundreds of "commando units" for madcap drills for intruding into strategic and tactical targets of the DPRK and scouting and destroying them in "contingency" in the period from Oct. 11 to 30. 
						
						They were busy with offensive operation exercises in the areas of Mugon-ri, Phaju City and Tosin-ri, Ryonchon County of Kyonggi Province on Oct. 8 and 26.
						
						The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces brought the nuclear-powered submarine Ohio equipped with guided missiles to the U.S. navy base in Yokosuka of Japan on Oct. 16. They also sent the strike group of the nuclear carrier "George Washington" to Pusan and Phyongthaek ports between Oct. 6 and 10 so that they might participate in war maneuvers in waters around the Korean Peninsula for more than 10 days.
						
						Guided missile destroyers of the navy of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces were busy staging a naval operation drill in a coordinated operation with warships of the south Korean puppet navy after entering Tonghae and Jinhae ports of south Korea on Oct. 21 and 28. The south Korean puppets mobilized nearly 20 warships including destroyers and submarines for staging naval war, naval intrusion and submarine battle exercise in the waters east of Sokcho on Oct. 27.
						
						 The south Korean puppet navy was busy with the drills for naval intrusion and landing operation in the areas of Kanghwa Island and Kimpho peninsula on Oct. 24. It staged a "naval bombardment exercise" in the waters off Phohang from Oct. 14 to 16, stirring up war fever.
						
						 On Oct. 14 and 15, overseas-based F-16, F/A-18 and KC-135 of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces flew in the sky over south Korea to conduct intensive aerial espionage against the DPRK almost everyday.
						
						 Guam-based formations of B-52H flew in the air over south Korea periodically to stage a madcap exercise for striking ground targets in combination with the long-distance navigation drill for dropping bombs and returning to their bases.
						
						 On Oct. 28, the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppets let strategic and tactical reconnaissance planes make shuttle flights in the sky over the forefront area to commit monitoring and aerial photographing and electronic reconnaissance against areas of the north. 
						
						 The number of cases of espionage committed by the U.S. imperialists against the DPRK in October reached more than 90 and the number of those perpetrated by the south Korean puppet forces in the same period over 60.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Announce "Hoguk Exercises"
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Announce "Hoguk Exercises"

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet bellicose forces announced that they would stage "Hoguk exercises" from October 30 to November 8, according to Yonhap News and KBS of south Korea.
						 Involved in the exercises will be two ground corps, the "Metropolitan Garrison Command," two naval fleets, a combat air division and division-level forces of the Marine Corps of the south Korean puppet armed forces.
						
						 During the military exercises the puppet warmongers are going to stage river-crossing exercises, integrated exercises for defending important facilities and regions, taking-off and landing exercises in emergency runway, naval mobile and firing exercises and other offensive war exercises in sky, land and sea of south Korea, including areas around Seoul, Ryoju and Richon of Kyonggi Province, Phohang of North Kyongsang Province and the West Sea of Korea.
						
						 What is more serious is that they decided to stage large-scale landing exercises in league with the U.S. imperialists during the above-said military exercises.
						
						 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers announced that more than 10,000 troops including one regiment of the U.S. Marine Corps and two regiments of the south Korean puppet Marine Corps would be hurled into the landing exercises.
						
						 This is a very ill-boding movement as the past landing exercises were staged mainly by the south Korean puppet Marine Corps with the involvement of a very small number of the U.S. forces.
						
						 The puppet warmongers are attempting to startle the DPRK by staging various names of war exercises with mobilization of huge armed forces. However, they should be clearly mindful that such reckless moves will accelerate their own destruction.

articles.title: Actions to Force Lee Myung Bak Dictatorial Regime to Step Down Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions to Force Lee Myung Bak Dictatorial Regime to Step Down Called for in S. Korea

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea made public the statement titled "Lee Myung Bak dictatorial regime, remember the end of the 'Yusin' dictatorship" on Oct. 27.
						 29 years have passed since the October resistance for democracy in south Korea, the statement noted, adding that the resistance taught a lesson of history that those in power are bound to meet a miserable end if they betray the people.
						
						 Lee still seems not to fear the people, it said, and went on:
						
						 The Lee regime brought the economy to bankruptcy and is now shifting the blame for it onto the people after suppressing the candlelight actions in disregard of them. It is busy with military exercises with the U.S., trumpeting about "no nukes, opening and 3,000 dollars" towards the north where compatriots live. 
						
						 It is keen on sycophancy toward the U.S. and provocations to the people. Its true colors have already been brought to light. 
						
						 The youth and students in south Korea will force the Lee dictatorial regime to step down and build a new society, independent and democratic, by inheriting the spirit of the above-said resistance.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Suppression Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Suppression Denounced in S. Korea

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) released a statement on Oct. 27 in protest against the suppression by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
						 The statement recalled that the police withdrew its forces on Oct. 26 without uttering any word of apology for having thrown a cordon around the KCTU's office and disturbed its work and perpetrated human rights abuses for three months.
						
						 It accused the police of persisting in its suppression of the organization as evidenced by its action to reinforce forces around Jogye Temple in Seoul where the chairman of the KCTU stays.
						
						 This action proved itself that the police is a tool of the regime of big businesses and the dictatorial regime, it charged. 
						
						 The crackdown upon the organization is aimed at blocking candlelight actions, the statement declared, urging the Lee "government" and police to stop all repressive actions and immediately withdraw its forces from the temple.

articles.title: Withdrawal of Plan for S. Korea-U.S. Joint Landing Exercise Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of Plan for S. Korea-U.S. Joint Landing Exercise Demanded in S. Korea 

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea, the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea and the Headquarters of Youth and Students of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and three other civic and social and youth and students organizations called a press conference in the front of the puppet Ministry of National Defence on Oct. 28 demanding the withdrawal of the puppet warmaniacs' plan for staging a joint landing exercise with the U.S. imperialists.
						 Speakers at the press conference accused the U.S. and the south Korean authorities of planning to stage the large-scale joint landing exercise as part of the "Hoguk exercises," adding that such reckless act of stabbing one with a dagger, while talking about "peace" before one can never be tolerated.   
						
						 A press release read out at the press conference noted that the landing exercise is a typical offensive exercise which strongly suggests the meaning of a military threat to the north.
						
						 What is more dangerous is that the said plan is being pushed forward at a time when the Lee Myung Bak group's moves to upgrade "CONPLAN 5029" into "OPLAN" are being put into practice, it held.
						
						 It urged the Lee Myung Bak "government" to direct efforts to the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration to improve the inter-Korean relations and immediately stop the hostile acts which will strain the situation.
						
						 If the projected exercise throws bigger hurdles in the way of the inter-Korean relations, the Lee "government" will be held wholly accountable for the ensuing consequences, it warned.

articles.title: Anniversary of Opening of DPRK-Romania Diplomatic Ties Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Opening of DPRK-Romania Diplomatic Ties Observed

					
						 Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting and Korean photo, fine art work and handicraft exhibitions were held in Bucharest and Tirgoviste city, Dimbovita County in the period from Oct. 15 to 27 to mark the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Romania.
						Displayed in the venues of the exhibitions were photos, fine art works and handicrafts showing the true picture of Songun Korea.
						
						 Present at the functions were personages of the Romanian government, political parties and organizations and popular masses and the DPRK ambassador to Romania and his embassy officials.
						
						 Speeches were made there.
						
						 The general secretary of the Ministry of Culture said at the friendly meeting that the DPRK is a country with potentiality for better development, and expressed the will to make positive efforts for the development of the relations between the two countries in various fields.

articles.title: Clausurada Conferencia de Cruz Roja de la RPDC
articles.content:
Clausurada Conferencia de Cruz Roja de la RPDC

					
						Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 29 y 30 en la capitalina Casa Cultural Chollima la Conferencia de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
						 En el conclave participaron los funcionarios de esta rama en el centro y las localidades, inclusive los miembros del CC de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la RPDC. 
						
						 Fueron invitados los miembros de las delegaciones de la Federacion Internacional de las Sociedades de la Cruz Roja y Medialuna Roja y del Comite Internacional de la Cruz Roja, que laboran en Corea.
						
						 El informe de balance del trabajo del CC de la ACR de la RPDC estuvo a cargo de su presidente Jang Jae On. 
						
						Jang enumero los exitos logrados en el periodo del que se balancea y apunto que la ACR debe contribuir a la mejora de la vida de los damnificados en diferentes desastres y tomar en el centro de sus actividades higienicas y sanitarias el cumplimiento de la mision humanitaria encaminada a proteger y fomentar la salud de las personas. 
						
						 La ACR se esforzara activamente por resolver entre los connacionales los problemas humanitarios basandose en la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre y por desarrollar la cooperacion con la Federacion Internacional de las Sociedades de la Cruz Roja y Medialuna Roja, el Comite Internacional de la Cruz Roja y las entidades homologas de todos los paises. 
						
						 Acto seguido, hubo discursos. 
						
						 En la ocasion fueron modificados los estatutos de la ACR de la RPDC y discutidos la estrategia de desarrollo y el rumbo de los trabajos por ramas hasta 2012. 
						
						 El CC de la ACR de la RPDC ofrecio el dia 30 un banquete con motivo del dia de su fundacion y de la conferencia.

articles.title: Clausurada XI Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo
articles.content:
Clausurada XI Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo

					
						 Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurada este viernes en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang la XI Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
						 En la ocasion se establecieron nuevos recordes nacionales en las 18 subdivisiones de tiro, tiro al arco, atletismo, natacion y levantamiento de pesas.
						
						 En la seccion de equipos deportivos, los jugadores del Equipo Deportivo 25 de Abril resultaron ganadores en el futbol femenino, el baloncesto de ambos sexos y el voleibol de ambos sexos mientras los muchachos del Equipo Deportivo Sobaeksu ocuparon el primer lugar en el futbol masculino.
						
						 En la rama de deportes masivos, los jugadores capitalinos ocuparon el primer lugar en el baloncesto masculino y el voleibol de ambos sexos y los del Ministerio del Ferrocarril, en el futbol y el baloncesto femenino.
						
						 En la ceremonia de clausura estuvieron presentes el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Jung Rin, el viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros Kwak Pom Gi, los funcionarios de las entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, deportistas y trabajadores.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda ejecucion de declaraciones intercoreanas
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda ejecucion de declaraciones intercoreanas

					
						Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ATCC) -- No toleraremos ni en lo minimo, sino haremos frente mas rotundo a las maniobras antinacionales de la banda de Lee Myung Bak, que fomenta la confrontacion fratricida negando la ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, que resulta el programa para implementar la primera.
						 Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual del dia 31 y continua:
						
						 Recientemente, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cuestiono gravemente a las actuales autoridades surcoreanas que en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras llevan las relaciones Norte-Sur, que se desarrollaban favorablemente, a la aguda confrontacion creada antes de la publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y ratifico su posicion de principios sobre estas relaciones.
						
						Pero, la banda de Lee, que no toma en consideracion el pais, la nacion y la reunificacion, responde groseramente con intensificar su campana conflictiva con la RPDC.
						
						 Ellas censuran la justa posicion del Norte hablando del supuesto "chantaje" y "lastima" y sueltan sofisterias para justificar su antinacional "politica hacia el Norte".
						
						 La ejecucion de las declaraciones arriba mencionadas deviene la unanime aspiracion de la nacion coreana y la demanda de la historia nacional.
						
						 Pero, esa horda insulta y atenta el sistema de la  RPDC y hasta se atreve a exponer abiertamente su intento de agredirla llevando asi las relaciones Norte-Sur a la situacion a punto de explosion.
						
						Hablando tanto de los "preparativos para hacer frente a la situacion bruscamente cambiada" de alguien, los belicistas titeres surcoreanos debatieron en la reciente "40a reunion consultiva anual para la seguridad" Sur de Corea-EE.UU ese peligroso plan de guerra nuclear con el proposito de fortalecer el "sistema de cooperacion militar" encaminado a aplastar a la RPDC y perfeccionar la disposicion general para pasar a la operacion de ataque contra ella. 
						
						 Por otra parte, convierten en papel mojado todos los acuerdos militares Norte-Sur siguiendo el provocativo esparcimiento de volantes.
						
						 Todo esto demuestra patentemente su ambicion belicosa de negar la idea y el sistema de la RPDC y aplastarla, cueste lo que cueste, en contubernio con las fuerzas foraneas.
						
						 No pueden perdonar jamas las censuras e improperios como "chantaje" y "lastima" de esa pandilla sobre las justas contramedidas de la RPDC.
						
						Es que esos insultos parten del alma anti-reunificacion de la banda de Lee que niega la idea y el sistema de la RPDC y trata de envenenar a toda costa el ambiente a favor de la implementacion de las declaraciones intercoreanas, de la cual dependen enteramente el desarrollo de las relaciones Norte-Sur, la paz del pais y la prosperidad comun de la nacion coreana.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun senala cooperacion Sur-Sur en rama agricola
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun senala cooperacion Sur-Sur en rama agricola

					
						Pyongyang, 31 de octubre (ATCC) -- La realidad de hoy demanda a los paises en vias de desarrollo fortalecer la cooperacion Sur-Sur en la rama agricola.
						Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este viernes y continua:
						
						Es posible la cooperacion en el sector agricola  de los paises en vias de desarrollo.
						
						Estos paises tienen la mayor parte de recursos agricolas y humanos del mundo y disponen de no pocas experiencias y tecnologias intercambiables en dicho sector. 
						
						Si estos paises intercambian y divulgan a cada una sus experiencias y tecnicas, podran solucionar numerosos problemas que se presentan en la rama.
						
						Al ayudar y cooperar sinceramente sobre los principios de igualdad, beneficio mutuo y comercio mutuamente beneficioso, estos paises pueden desarrollar la agricultura y autoabastecerse de alimentos.
						
						Los paises occidentales piensan absurdamente como si no fuera posible la solucion del problema alimentario sin intervencion de ellos mismos. Bajo tal condicion, los paises en vias de desarrollo deben fortalecer la cooperacion Sur-Sur para demostrar a aquellos que podran solucionarlo por sus propios esfuerzos.
						
						La cooperacion Sur-Sur debe realizarse ante todo en la esfera agricola para autoabastecerse de  alimentos que son el problema mas urgente en los paises en vias de desarrollo.
						
						Estos tienen la comunidad de la posicion historica, la aspiracion actual y la posibilidad de cooperacion favorable. Por esta razon, si estos paises fomentan la cooperacion e intercambio bilateral o regional, podran fortalecer el autososten de la agricultura sin apoyarse en los paises desarrollados y lograr grandes exitos en la solucion del problema alimentario.
						
						Los paises en vias de desarrollo deben sacar lecciones de que debido a las injustas maniobras de los imperialistas, no alcanzan grandes exitos en la solucion de la crisis alimentaria y hacer ingentes esfuerzos para la cooperacion Sur-Sur en el sector agricola.
						
						He aqui el medio correcto para solucionar cuanto antes el problema alimentario y lograr el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad.
